title: Remove `type` when `const` is present
description: `const` fixes the instance to a single value, which already determines its primitive type.

comprehensiveExamples.title: Wrong: Redundant scalar type with const
comprehensiveExamples.description: `const` determines the instance type; a separate `type` is unnecessary.

comprehensiveExamples.title: Wrong: Union includes the const's type redundantly
comprehensiveExamples.description: A union that includes the const's primitive is redundant.

comprehensiveExamples.title: Right: const alone is sufficient
comprehensiveExamples.description: Using only const is clear and correct.
